intro: Dodecatheon pauciflorum var. cusickii, commonly known as the Cusick's globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, characterized by its showy, showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It has hairy, alternate leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is often found in wildflower gardens and natural habitats.
